alert.note: Alert for Amherst; Appomattox; Bedford; Campbell; Rockbridge (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 7:27AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Appomattox, central Rockbridge, north central Campbell, northeastern Bedford, and Amherst Counties, the City of Buena Vista, the City of Lexington and the City of Lynchburg through 800 AM EDT... At 726 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Oronoco, or near Buena Vista, moving southeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lynchburg... Lexington... Buena Vista... Amherst... Glasgow... Forks Of Buffalo... and Big Island. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
